info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 8:36PM EDT until July 23 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, Holmes, Walton and Washington.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vernon, Bonifay, Chipley, Bradford, Live Oak, Ponce De Leon, Caryville, Wausau, Westville, Whitehead Crossroads, Five Points, Hinsons Crossroads, Hulaw, Gritney, Johnson Crossroads, Holmes Valley, Cerrogordo, Millers Ferry, Poplar Head and Sylvania. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Holmes, FL; Walton, FL; Washington, FL
